newsitem.title: GERMANY: Buba's Kuehbacher - no need for interest rate rise.
newsitem.headline: Buba's Kuehbacher - no need for interest rate rise.

text.p: Bundesbank council member Klaus-Dieter Kuehbacher said on Tuesday Germany's economy would grow by 2.25 percent at most in 1997 and that he saw no need for interest rate rises at present.
The Bundesbank had ensured "absolute price stability" and could do no more to improve economic conditions, Kuehbacher told a news conference.
At the moment I see no need for interest rate rises," he said.
Kuehbacher is president of the state central bank for Berlin and Brandenburg.
